Reviews.Title: Great Price Brings Upgraded Features
Reviews.Author: The Bronx
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from QVC (it was their special value for that day) on their easy pay plan.I began using this camera out of the box, on its auto settings indoors; it takes some very impressive photos. I was happy to see that my min pin didnt suffer the usual "I am a vicious red eyed dog" look. To compare the usefulness of the flash, I took photos in absolute darkness and then used the flash. It was great to see that the flash really did its thing without the great wash out effect. The flash worked just as well in regular settings that required it.I used the other features for the photos I am going to describe in this paragraph. I work in the buildings behind the World Trade Center so taking pictures of the progress from our office is priceless. On this camera, the pictures are the kind that everyone who visits wishes they could take from this view. I had no light "bounce back" from the several floors of newly installed windows on the Freedom Tower (still under construction). The zoom feature is so amazing that I was able to zoom in on a worker cleaning out one of the reflecting pools. It was not a blurry "it could be anything" picture, you can clearly see him, the color of his skin, shirt, jeans and the hose he was using. I also have views of the Statue of Liberty, the surrounding islands and New Jersey. I used the zoom on these photos, again, amazing clear detailed photographs.I'm still an amateur when it comes to using this camera but honestly you don't need major brains to figure this guy out. There are several settings for babies, snow, beach, flowers, night etc. Every one of the pictures I took with each of these settings came out VERY nice and clear with no doubt of what you just photo'd. You can take videos and also use the view finder. The camera is able to use any size SD card (I have 16Gs in mine) and standard AA batteries (this one needs four). My advice is get two sets of good rechargeable batteries. It is less expensive in the long run and you will always be ready to capture anything you find interesting.An instruction manual is included for those who may have trouble figuring out certain settings or icons. There are manual settings which are good for those "professionals" who are tired of dragging around their heavy telescopes (I see your types when you come to visit us in NYC) around their necks but still want to get that quality shot.In my opinion, this is a serious step up for anyone who still owns a pocket camera because of the quality of the zoom, panorama, pixels and other features that pocket cameras lack.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera with great features
Reviews.Author: Michael Gustafson
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. I bought it because it has an old school view finder and the display.  Most of the cameras I have looked at have gone away from having a view finder.  I have used many different cameras and on bright day it is very hard to see the display and line up a shot without a view finder. It is very easy to switch between the view finder and the display.It takes fantastic pictures and you can use rechargeable batteries if you want.  Another thing that is great about this camera is the response time between pictures.  My old camera took 10 seconds before I could snap another shot.  This camera is almost instantaneous.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Deal, Fabulous Camera
Reviews.Author: Kala Krugman
Reviews.Content: This camera takes beautiful pictures, and the pop-up flash works fantastic even in total darkness.  Pictures are crisp and clear, and the manual settings are great for advanced photographers.  The editing software in the camera is helpful too so you can crop, rotate or resize your photos before uploading them, as well as saving them to their own albums for later.  I would very highly recommend this camera to anyone who wants to take thousands of casual everyday pictures, or step it up a notch and take professional grade photos.

Reviews.Title: Not too Impressed
Reviews.Author: forevertide
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a birthday gift from my sister.  I was very excited at first because it has similar features as my Panasonic which I like it very much, and this one even includes a PANORAMA function that I thought was awesome.  However, after I tried it out I found out why it is selling with a much lower price than the other similar models: The indoor shots are of very poor quality (as the other reviewer has mentioned, including the consentaneous comment attached to that review).  The outdoor shots are much better but no way great.I give it a three star for the affordable price, and the very easy-to use panorama function (although it does not always result in a smooth wide-angle looking picture, many times the pictures are connected with obvious kinks).

Reviews.Title: After several months of usage;
Reviews.Author: Thy Nguyen
Reviews.Content: I read all of the reviews for this camera on Amazon and other sites prior to purchasing.  I'm not a professional photography, but I am a journalist, I need good quality photos from anywhere, anytime.  As far as my photos go?  They're excellent, I mean, you're not going to get magazine ready photos unless you know what you're doing, but there's two automatic settings for amateurs, which is what I use the most because when I'm taking candid photos, I don't really have time to sit there and fiddle with the exposure or anything else.The zoom is for days!  I love it.  They're great for taking photos at a football game, or anywhere you can't be up close and personal.The only bad thing I have to say about the camera is that the battery door IS flimsy.  I saw the comments on it so I was cautious with my camera when I first got it.  Since the memory card is in the same spot at the batteries, you have to open the door to get your photos, but, the camera comes with its cords.  So I make sure I always have my cord with me everywhere and I always use it to take pictures off of my camera.The lens cap is pretty "flimsy" too.  The cap itself is fine, but it isn't a cap that you squeeze on the sides so it unlatches and latches to your camera, it just slides on.  Which means it comes off pretty easy.  But, when I'm holding my camera bag in one hand and pulling my camera out with the other.  I don't really have any hand to take the cap off with, so it's nice sometimes to be able to just scoot it off by dragging the lens against the inside of my camera bag.I don't think the camera is very fragile.  I've dropped my camera once because the strap got caught on the corner of a corner when I went to pick my camera up.  It didn't land on the lens though, the bottom of my camera where the batteries are hit the floor, and my door burst open and my batteries rolled everywhere, but everything still works perfectly fine.In all honestly, you could a small, compact digital camera from Sony or even Fuji as well for the same price, and the same quality camera.  But I choose to buy the FinePixS2950 because I like have something sturdy to hold in my hands, and I LOVE the viewfinder.  It's a legit viewfinder, what you see, is what you get.  I had a Sony CyberShot that I loved, but when the screen cracked and I was resorted to using the viewfinder, I noticed if I zoomed in all the way.. my picture was completely off of what I wanted to take a photo of.  This Fuji has an electronic view finder though, which also means I can switch from the LCD screen when it's sunny outside and see what I'm doing.I LOVE my camera, and it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Great point and shoot to use in place of a DSLR
Reviews.Author: Emily
Reviews.Content: I got this camera after my Sony Alpha a290 was stolen to not necessarily replace it, but to have until I can afford a new one. The camera is a bit bulky, but that is the only con I have. It is great for being on the go because it is still much smaller than a DSLR, and can take beautiful pictures. I mostly use the Macro setting for nature photography, so that was a main reason I chose this camera, and it does not disappoint. It is also great in low-light at night. GREAT BUY! And an excellent, affordable camera for a learning or amateur photographer, with it's easy controls and great quality.

Reviews.Title: I am THRILLED to own this Camera!
Reviews.Author: Miss Lurker
Reviews.Content: if you have a faulty Camera then send it back but if not, learn it before you comment about it! .. I don't understand all the negative feedback.. I almost didn't purchase one because of it! .. I'm glad I decided to do some research and make up my own mind.. do a search at YouTube and look for the fujiguys channel.. they have videos to get you familiar with it and the features PLUS they answer any questions you may have! .. and if you want to see some actual photos taken with the Camera, do a search at Flickr! .. I ordered this Camera and got it a day and a half later which was awesome! .. I already knew some things about it because I done some research.. after playing with it for awhile, it was very easy for me to work it and I'm use to Kodak Cameras.. you have got to see the photos taken with this Camera!.. don't expect great results without knowing what you are doing though! .. the only bad thing about the Camera is the software that comes with it.. I got errors and removed it and found out others have had problems as well.. you can still transfer the photos without the software .... my favorite things about the Camera are the super macro and the Panorama.. the Panorama is so easy, it's almost funny! .. you snap the first photo, line the on-screen plus sign up and the Camera takes another for you, then do it again.. it's VERY simple!!.. don't take my word for it or others for that matter.. do your own research and make up your own mind.. it's more than I expected and I love it!..

Reviews.Title: BANG FOR THE BUCK
Reviews.Author: kensil
Reviews.Content: Have had this for a couple months, now. Cool little camera! If you're not into spending $500+ for a DSLR, this is probably the next best thing. Many functions of a DSLR, but no ability to change lenses. A little slow between photos, but acceptable for the amateur. Quality of photos very good thanks to 14 megapixels. I was surprised at the zoom - 18x, but I guess I didn't realize the power of 18! I'd use the word "awesome", but... One of my must-have features was a viewfinder, which is hard to find on point-and-shoot cameras. I find it easier to use, bracing it against your face gives you a steadier hand, and it gives you a more precise view than the screen. The size is perfect - lightweight and easy to carry around. Feels good in hands. Grip allows one-handed shooting if necessary. Videos are clear. Sound could be better, but, hey, the camera is less than $200! A snap to transfer photos/videos to your pc, Facebook, etc. All-in-all, an excellent value. Took this thing to Yosemite twice and got some brilliant photos and videos.  Pleased as puch, I am.

Reviews.Title: Good Photos - Sometimes - If You Work Hard
Reviews.Author: Alan  Houston
Reviews.Content: I bought an earlier version of this Fujifilm camera because of my wonderful experience with the Fujifilm S5700.  I wanted the wider 28mm zoom on this model, and so I thought I was "upgrading".The S2950 uses AA batteries, which are easy to find.  Someone who takes only 300 or 400 photos each year could put in a set of AA lithium batteries, and only change batteries once a year.With "pre-charged" AA rechargeable batteries, you can get more than 600 photos per charge without flash, or about 200 photos per charge if you use the flash for every photo. Because the batteries can be recharged several hundred times, you can get several years of use from a set of batteries.In fact, I have found that getting good photos from this camera requires some thought, and some work.  My best results have come from using the "Aperture Mode" and locking the ISO at ISO 64 and the Aperture at f/4.  In good sunlight, most photos are reasonably good, although the camera tends to shift blues toward purple, and reds toward orange.Most of my family and friends have dark brown skin tones, which the S2950 shifts toward greenish-brown or orange-brown, especially with flash photos.  The results with paler "anglo" skin tones are better, with the camera adding a bit of ruddiness to pale skin that looks attractive.In various auto modes, the results are often poor, as the camera selects ISO 400 even in good light, resulting in photos that are grainy and lack fine detail, contrast, and color saturation.  The solution is to use manual modes, lock the ISO at ISO 64 and f/4.The BIGGEST problem is that my camera has focus problems in temperatures above about 90 degrees.  In Texas, afternoon temperatures stay above 90 degrees from the end of April to the beginning of October.  Shooting outdoors in the summer requires taking each photo two or three times, in hopes that one photo will be sharply focused.The strong point of this camera is that it sells for half the price of comparable Panasonic and Canon cameras.  Among "Super Zooms", the S2950 is a real bargain...worth the extra work it takes to get good photos if you want a "Super Zoom" and are on a tight budget.Buy it if you are willing to WORK at getting good photos, and you are willing to take a photo two or three times to get one good picture.  However, if you want a camera that you can just turn on, snap away on automatic, and get great results, this is NOT the camera for you.

Reviews.Title: Target audience apparently not that smart.
Reviews.Author: dpawl31
Reviews.Content: I have to say this. Too many people turn this camera down because it doesn't do well in the auto shooting format. Well I am here to say something. I didn't purchase this to shoot genetic automatic Shots. I bought it for the powerful lens, but mostly the fact it has nearly full manual controls. If you want a standard point and shoot, look elsewhere. to sell this at this price point and afford to put these manual controls, they had to sacrifice somewhere. Buy a point and shoot at this price point with no manual controls you'll be happier if you don't want manual control.Now that that is over with, I'll tell you what's great. Zoom is great especially macro. Having the evf is great for stable shots. photos are crisp, well colored and very detailed. ISO200/400 is great for everyday use. All of this paragraph is referring to full manual mode shooting. Aperture and shutter priority is great as well.Only flaws? Video optical zoom is noisy, and photo ISO noise is rough advice 800.This camera it's not a point and shoot. For the price the manual controls are amazing. Panoramic shots are awesome with the right scene. If you want more power than just a point and shoot, get this camera.This camera deserves more respect, don't knock it for something it want intended for.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera with crisp picture clarity
Reviews.Author: Sparky
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera which was a part of a graduation gift by my friends. For me it serves the purpose of mini slr camera and I love the way pictures come out. They are very crisp and clear. Also, with the non shakiness the blurriness is reduced. All in all a good purchase for the price.Pros: It's very light weight, less blurry pictures, not to noisy, excellent zoom, too many functionsCons: Works on 4 AA cells and hence is a pain (keep rechargeable batteries along with), bit bulky than normal digi cams

Reviews.Title: takinpics
Reviews.Author: AHartley96
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for school at the beginning of June for my photography class. I'm not going to mumble on about the specs of this thing but how well it does its job. (we all know we use automatic mode half the time and it takes good pics in auto mode.) This camera is very good and takes astounding photos but, when the battery gets low the pictures suffer a lot. This one mode called panorama is amazing, it matches up, up to 3 pictures to create a long scene which is amazing! My 1 and only gripe is that the zoom will not work sometimes, usually a matter of turning off and on but still, annoying!

Reviews.Title: Watch your shutter speed!
Reviews.Author: Richard Bruce Wood
Reviews.Content: With careful use this camera can give very sharp photographs, but only if you watch what you are doing. This is especially true at the extremes of camera's operating range.Telephoto photography requires either a tripod or very short exposures. For example without a tripod a shutter speed of 1/250th is required at 9X, and 1/500th at 18X.Macro photography results in a very limited depth of field (i.e. the distance that a 3D object remainds in focus). Another pitfall of macro photography is the motion of either the object or the camera. A tripod or a very steady hand is required. Using the electronic viewfinder and balance your elbows against your torso will help steady the camera. Pray that there is no wind to move the object.In summary this excellent camera will take excellent photos if used carefully.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: *~amanda marie*~
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after my other digital camera was stolen.  its an upgrade from my other one so it took me a little while to figure out all the different functions.  I love this camera it takes great pictures!  i wanted something profesional but not too extreme i am a beginner and wanted something easy.  this is the camera!  i think its great for beginers as well as someone that knows what they are doing!  Highly Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: Perfect upgrade
Reviews.Author: neosapien
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera a week ago from Best Buy when it was on sale.  I am going on a trip to China and was thinking that I would kick myself if I didn't invest in a new Camera.  The s2950 seemed like the most bang for your buck.  It is.  I have always been a fan of Fuji after previously owning there Finepix F20.  I did a side by side comparison of the photos took by each and there is hands-down no question proof that the S2950 takes much much better shots and is a vast improvement over my antiquated F20. I mean I could visually see how awesome the S2950 is.  Lots of features, half of which I won't use.  The 18x zoom is incredible.  The panorama as others have said is very awesome and very easy to use.  The pictures themselves are very crisp and clear.  The people saying it only takes ok pictures obviously aren't using the correct settings for their situation.  I also like the shutter select option as I plan on taking some artsy waterfall pictures while I'm there.  The pop-up flash is powerful.  This is the first camera I've owned with a pop-up so I've caught myself acouple times forgetting to pop it up. The lens cap as others have said is flimsy. It has yet to fall off but once I put it in a bag I imagine it will.  The battery and SDHC compartment door also seems flimsy, going to have to be careful as you should be any way. All in all I'm extremely happy with my investment and haven't second guessed it since I took the first picture. 5/5.

Reviews.Title: WOW
Reviews.Author: marie morris
Reviews.Content: I like reading reviews, and also it can be bad.. Some people will write the worst reviews about everything, leaving you to be just as skeptical as they are. I am going to tell you the truth.Some of the reviewers are exaggerating, its not so simple to use. I just got it out the box, I automatically knew how to pop open the flash, and how to use auto mode. Everything else you need to read in the manual which is a "BASIC manual" the fuller more developed manual you will have to download off their website or buy!! I was reading the manual it tells me to go to page 98 and 101 for extended explanation on features, but this manual only consists of around 25 pages!! In 3 languages!There are TONS of features. I turned the light off in my living room, It was pitch dark, I took a pic with the flash, it came out crisp , clear, and bright!! I tested the zoom for blur, it was not blurry at all, still crisp!Love this camera very happy I purchased it and not the NIKKON L120 for that high price. This total cost me $161 was $147 and tax made it $161. May buy more for the family. Refuse to share my own :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: Cstar
Reviews.Content: I have to say I am a fan of Fuji, and this camera is no exception. I wanted to upgrade to a higher megapixel camera and this seemed the right fit for me. The cosmetic changes Fuji made compared to my old camera are minor.(I'm glad they didn't change the body style)It's still light enough so that it doesn't feel bulky but sturdy enough that it "feels" like a camera. They moved the media card slot inside with the batteries (I prefer them separate) but it is better than the media card slot on the older version of this camera which tended to pop open unknowingly. You do have to be aware of how you're holding the camera so you don't lose the batteries. I also liked the versatility of being able to use more than one type of media card (they removed that feature on this camera). They added the panoramic feature which is cool and the shutter speed is faster so that makes the continuous mode a lot more fun to use! The auto flash feature you have to engage ( it was automatic on the older version) Overall, still a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Definitely a great deal for the price
Reviews.Author: jchop
Reviews.Content: I don't write reviews often on Amazon, but I felt compelled to write one for this camera. In my opinion there are many misleading reviews for this product. I've been using the camera for a few days without any issues. I actually found the quality of the picture to be quite good, and the shutter time is pretty quick. Sometimes the HD movies have trouble focusing but it didn't seem to be a big disruption.Everyone saying that the camera has lousy shutter times in between pictures, probably has a crappy SD card in it. I went from a microSD card in an adapter (class 2 maybe?) to a class 10 SDHC card. BIG difference in shutter time. It would take about a second in between pictures, now its no more than 1/2 second in between. So if your shutter takes a while in between pictures, get a better SD card. Make sure it has a fast write speed (class 6 or above is best). Fujifilm's site recommends class 4 or higher.As for the picture quality being poor, I've tried my camera in all different lighting conditions. In doors during the day with and w/o flash. Outside during the day, and night with flash. Zoomed in and out. Picture quality isn't GREAT but its very good. I read the manual and tweaked the settings for the picture quality on the camera which seemed to help. Make sure its set to Image size = L(16:9), and Image quality = F (fine). This should give you the best quality pictures with the camera.Bottom line, no this isn't going to be a great camera, but its a very good one for the price range its in. Your average person would like this camera but its not for people big into photography.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: E. Hernandez
Reviews.Content: This is an SLR Style digital camera meaning that while offering a lot of the same features as an Digital SLR it does not offer the ability to switch lenses and certain other higher end features.  However, If you are not a pro photographer and have no aspirations to be one or are on a budget and just starting this is a high qualty 14 mp Camera with just about every feature of the DSLRs and an amazing lens range and image quality at a tenth of the price! It is also light enough to handle with one hand.The box comes with batteries, a nice strap, a lens cover, a quick start paper manual, a splitter cable that will allow the camera to communicate directly with your tv video/audio in ports or via usb to your Win 7 PC, and a cd with a full owner's manual and a crapy photo software I don't recomend installing. The box does not come with storage card and the camera does not have internal memory, which for me was no draw back since as a computer geek I had a handful of sd cards and adapter for micro and mini sd memory cards laying around the desktop and just dropped in a 16 gb card and it was recognized and I was able to start shooting right away.  I think the sd mem card was a kingston brand micro card in an sd adapter.  I'm pretty sure anything recognized by Windows will be recognized by the camera so if you have one laying around you don't have to get another right away.This is a great value without compromising quality and functionality and I recomend it Highly.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for a pont and shoot
Reviews.Author: Immilling
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera on sale from a different vender, but was able to use my Amazon Prime account.  First I have to say, I ordered it on a Tuesday, and received it on Wednesday, not the next week, but the very next day.  I did not pay for overnight shipping, so I was all colors of impressed.  The first thing I noticed was the weight.  This camera is heavier than the average point and shoot camera, and larger too.  It won't fit in a pocket.  The packaging was nice, and well thought out. The initial setup was easy, and the camera took great pictures right out of the box.  I set it to the finest, and largest picture setting, to get the best quality possible.  The pictures blew me away.  The flash works very well, and the time from shutter press to acquisition is nice.  There is very little delay.  and when set on continuous photo, there is none what so ever.  The 18x optical zoom is nice.  Having a high optical, low digital zoom is the key to a good photo under zoom situations.  The hand feel of this camera is nice, very much like a 35mm, and the view finder works nicely.  If you wanted to save the batteries, turn off the LCD screen and use the view finder.  Although this is NOT a SLR camera, and the lens is not changeable, this camera is very good for the price.  I am not a professional photographer.  I find  that I have great confidence when shooting photos.  If you are in the market for a camera that can do more than the basic point and shoot, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: Best budget camera I have ever bought
Reviews.Author: A. Parr
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera in an "emergency" in Kathmandu when my other camera failed the day before I was due to leave on a one month trek in the mountains. I didn't have a lot of time to compare cameras or read any reviews. The reason I wanted this one specifically is because it has a manual viewfinder (not just an LCD screen) which is hard to find in budget cameras these days! I hate the cameras that only have the LCD screen, because it is so hard to see what you are shooting in bright sunlight. I also wanted a camera that took normal batteries, rather than a special battery that had to be recharged. In the mountains there wasn't always electricity, so I would not be able to rely on being able to recharge my battery. I am so impressed with this camera, for the price I paid (which was more than what it is listed here!). I ended up taking some really amazing shots. It is funny too, because many people who don't know a lot about cameras see me with this one and think that it is a fancy, professional camera, haha, I guess because it is chunkier than the average budget point and shoot. Unlike most of the other little point and shoots these days that may only have 5x zoom, it has 18x optical zoom. You can't go wrong with the camera for the price you are paying, just buy it

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera
Reviews.Author: RamonR
Reviews.Content: The price very low with the features this camera has. A great acquisition... Images are very sharp, the flash is one-of-a-kind, is the best camera I've ever had

Reviews.Title: Really Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Shastafication
Reviews.Content: I have to say this camera does a really great job of taking pictures! I love it! This camera is really great if your wanting to get into photography. I bought this camera 12/26/11 a day before this review at Bestbuy and Was excited to unpackage it and start taking photos. I love the size of this camera and the x18 zoom it has. There are also many other features to play with on this camera. I took this photo of some china berries outside my house: [...]  and the photo quality looks good! Im just amazed with this camera. This camera does not take good quality photos if you don't have enough lighting or natural light. The more light you have the better =)I hope this review helps anyone buy this camera. I highly recommend this!

Reviews.Title: Great camera, very happy I purchased it.
Reviews.Content: I am a complete newbie to digital cameras other than BASIC point and shoot Kodak Easy Share I had about 6 years ago.  This camera is great for a beginner like me.  I shot some nice close ups of flowers outdoors in the macro setting and in auto setting just using the zoom feature, and am happy with both ways.  I did take multiple shots to get great ones, but that is probably typical. So far I have only used the auto setting, and the Scene recognition setting and am happy so far, looking forward to playing with manual settings soon.The camera is comfortable to hold and shoot both one and two handed.  Feels like a good solid camera.  The lens cap is basically useless and falls off if you look at it wrong, but no biggie.  I would recommend this to someone looking to get into photography and also for the weekend shot taker.Not sure about battery life as I have only had it for 3 days, but I have taken a few hundred shots so far and still going strong.  The Viewfinder is also great in the bright sunlight when the LCD doesn't show up as well, and all the info displayed on the LCD is also displayed in the viewfinder.If you are considering this camera, just go for it, you will like it.  I wavered for almost a month and wish I had just ordered it back then.  The price on Amazon is at least $20 cheaper than anywhere I have seen it in stores here in Michigan.

Reviews.Title: Neat  Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Russell W. Smith
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera because of the megapix size (14mp) and its compactness. I have a much more complicated Digital SLR, however it is just too bulky to take everywhere. This Fiji is graeat for outings, weekend trips, etc. The electronic viewfinder is great. I do not like the fact that so many of the newer generation digital cameras only have an LCD screen. I am from the old school 35mm photography and I insist on a viewfinder. I have been using 35mm film cameras for over forty years. The 3in LCD screen is quite nice to view your shots. The wide variety of exposure settings is impressive and suits any condition that I encountered thus far. I have had not had the S2950 long enough to express any cons just yet. So far I have been very pleased with the results.

Reviews.Title: Quick Help
Reviews.Author: Todd
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived quickly but I was disconcerted that the proprietary USB cable Fuji Film uses was absent. I called the company and they quickly responded by crediting my account the cost of a new cable. Great customer service that fixed my problem to the best of their ability since the cable is not sold separately by them. I would definitely recommend this company not only for their low prices, but the quality of their customer service.

Reviews.Title: S2950
Reviews.Author: n869yw
Reviews.Content: Serious camera for the price, more features than just a point and shoot.  If you are just capturing the moment, use your cell phone camera.  This is for taking quality pics.  Out of the box use is simple enough on Auto, but you will need to read the instruction book to get the most out of its many features.  Only down side is that the auto focus illuminator (used in low light settings) is very bright, almost laser like and can be distracting to the subject.  This can be turned off in the settings, but where it is placed, it is easier to just slide a finger in front of it lol!!Overall fit and finish is great, feel is solid, would recommend

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera-- everything I wanted
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: I am a total amateur when it comes to photography, but I wanted something that was a step up from my regular point and shoot digital camera. A lot of my friends are photographers and I would always be jealous of their amazing pictures. I was reluctant to purchase this based on the bad reviews, but I have had great luck with this camera. The pictures look professional, and the flash is incredible. I took some pictures of my friends out at a party last week and the flash lit up the entire room. Everyone wanted their picture taken with my camera. A girl even looked at a picture on my camera's screen and goes "Are you a professional photographer?" I'm so pleased with this camera. Pictures are better when the flash it used-- it's easily the camera's best feature. The zoom is also impressive. The lens cap does fall off too easily sometimes-- be sure to buy a bag for this camera. I'd definitely recommend this camera if you're looking for a step up from your regular digital camera.

Reviews.Title: I wish I'd known, so I'll tell you.....
Reviews.Author: TOM IN PA
Reviews.Content: I have yet to put my new S2950 to the test by actually using it in real field conditions, so perhaps I'm way premature in commenting; however, there are a couple of things that, had I been aware of them before the purchase, would have been deal breakers for me.The aperature ranges that I've seen published for the S2950 are F3.1-F6.4 (wide) and F5.6-F11 (tele).  What I haven't seen mentioned is that the extremes are the only settings one can choose on both Aperature Priority or Full Manual.  In other words, at any focal length, there are only two aperature settings that can be chosen--in the case of the shortest focal length, one is able to choose only F3.1 or F6.4, nothing between.  The other thing of which I was unaware is that, while a specific ISO can be set on Aperature and Full Manual, on Shutter Priority, ISO can be set only on Auto, with a ceiling of either ISO 400 or ISO 800.  I guess this makes sense; since the lens has only two aperature settings, the ISO has to slide to accomodate the partial stop differentials at which the shutter can be set, but that doesn't mean I have to like it.Before I close, I probably should mention that I'm a D-SLR user, used to complete control, who purchased this camera as a convenient option to allow me to take photos without five pounds of camera hanging from my neck.  As such, I might be looking for more than would the average bridge camera purchaser.  On the other hand, my old Kodak 610, which I foolishly gave away, allowed me the ability to set the aperature to any opening across its entire (wider)range, and to set a specific ISO in any photo mode.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Kt
Reviews.Content: For the price, I was a little skeptical that it wouldn't take good quality photos, but I love it, it can do so much and so reasonable priced!

Reviews.Title: Not an ideal replacement camera
Reviews.Author: Stormy1
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Fuji S2950 digital camera in the fall of 2011 and as I have had other Fuji digital cameras with fairly long zooms on their point & shoot cameras, I was disapointed with this camera. My intent was to replace my old Fuji S1000 12X optical zoom digital camera with this one, but I cannot as the older S1000 Fuji camera took clearly superiour pictures in all situations....day or in low light situations. I took this new Fuji S2950 camera to several outdoor events and used the "automatic" mode with no flash as it was broad daylight and the pictures mostly were blurred or "washed out"....a huge disapointment for me. I had to end up using a much smaller compact Fuji AX300 for my photos for both of those events, even tho the optical zoom on that compact camera was only 5X, their photos turned out much better.If I had to list the pros on this camera, I guess it would be that it's fairly easy to use, has an optical viewfinder, good flash and fairly long zoom. You also get a decent video with this camera in the video mode.Battery life is decent with this camera as it uses 4 "AA" batteries.The only con that I have had with this camera is the poor picture quality in any situation.It's a nice-looking digital camera with a decent zoom and plenty of features on it, but it simply did not live up to my expectations as an ideal replacement for my much older and now gone Fuji S1000 digital camera.If Fuji would have spent a bit more time with getting the camera to take a better picture in the Auto mode, then I would have given this camera a better review.

Reviews.Title: SUPER NICE CAMERA AT A NICE PRICE!
Reviews.Author: M. Meehan
Reviews.Content: My other camera was an Olympus 4mp, the first digital I ever bought. This camera is like comparing a Swiss Army knife to a butter knife! Very well made, a lot of features, and works great! I do a lot of EBay stuff and a digital camera is a must. I made do with the Olympus far too long.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera
Reviews.Author: blparent
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as an update from the one I've had for 6+ years. I am pleased with the picture quality and functions - especially the panoramic option. My only issue is that the lens cover never stays on.

Reviews.Title: NOTICE: THIS IS NOT A DSRL. Good for price.
Reviews.Author: Jaime Javier
Reviews.Content: Please, customers must know what they are buying before making a mistake. The price tells you everything.For a lot less than 200, you receive a good quality BRIDGE camera. A lot of extras and cool stuff like panorama.Excellent zoom!If you want to make a step foward, go from normal small digital cameras, to a more complete camera. This is your choise.Very pleased!

Reviews.Title: not impressed
Reviews.Author: helianthaster "paul"
Reviews.Content: I used this camera both indoors and outdoors, and I thought the image processing was slow, and the amount of light captured by the camera in low light conditions was surprisingly low for a camera this size. In fax, my little Optio performed better in low light with no flash. I also found it had to get the camera to focus on foreground in macro. I ended up selling it back to one of my guys for fifty bucks, because I am on a military installation where I can't mail things back over thirteen ounces. I'll just be spending 400 dollars on a decent camera, like the nice Canon I used to own.

Reviews.Title: New camera
Reviews.Author: SDH1903
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a direct replacement to one I had from last year that failed after a launch into the pool. I missed the camera so bad I had to have a replacement. Not only did I find the replacement it was the exact same camera, it was over $100.00 less in price. I am quite happy with the new camera and there were no hick ups in the ordering at all. Every step was smooth and effective-SDH1903

Reviews.Title: Enjoying my new camera.
Reviews.Author: V. Centeno
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a decent camera that will not break my bank account and this seems to be the one.  I've taken pictures as soon as the camera arrived and it works great.  Thanks to everyone who reviewed the camera as the majority were quite accurate.  The camera is easy to handle and comes with four AA batteries.  I bought a 32GB memory card the same time I bought the camera so that both arrived together.  Everything came together within a couple of days (memory card, camera case, and camera).  The pictures I've taken looks great, and I especially like the panorama feature.  If you want to record a video, a 32GB memory card will only record for 10 minutes before you run out of memory.  As to the durability and life of the camera, obviously I don't know since I only received the camera today.  But I must say, I recommend this camera as I am confident it will last a long time.

Reviews.Title: This is a sweet bang for the buck!
Reviews.Author: Rzer
Reviews.Content: I recently upgraded to the S2940 (Walmart sells the S2950 in their stores as the S2940), after using a Nikon Coolpix S570 for about a year. At this time, the price difference between my old Nikon and the new Fuji is around $30, and let me say that it is worth every penny and then some. The Fuji takes such better quality pictures, from low light to bright sunny light, and the video is drastically better because it's 720 high definition. All the features that you get are so much more useful and you actually will use them. At least I seem to. :O) The reason why I am comparing my old and new camera, is so when you read this little blurb, it will make you think twice about not investing a little more money into the camera. You'll get a noticable jump up in picture and video quality, plus getting some nice usable features that work well. Normal "point and shoot" cameras are decent and simple to use if you are a teenager or a great-grandparent, but point and shoot is just....point and shoot. Thanks for reading!

Reviews.Title: Buy very good
Reviews.Author: LUCIA CHAVEZ MUJICA
Reviews.Content: my purchase exceeded my expectations, I am not a professional photographer, but taking pictures with this camera as a professional, I love the macro capabilities.

Reviews.Title: Cool FinePix
Reviews.Author: Nikkita
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Camera - Just the right weight - not too light and not too heavy.  The LCD screen is large enough to be able to view your photos.  The only problem is - Watch out for the battery door.  It is so flimsy that it seems to be hanging on a thread.  Whoever invented this was not too clever.  A better system would have been like the old Fuji cameras where the XD or SD card was in a separate chamber.  This is why I did not rate the camera five stars.  Otherwise. for this inexpensive price you got yourself a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Camera
Reviews.Author: joeb
Reviews.Content: Only drawback is using panaroma - not enough instructions on framing the picture.  Having a viewfinder in addition to screen display is a terrific improvement in bright sunlight.

Reviews.Title: Say cheese!
Reviews.Author: Larry  Sementini
Reviews.Content: I thought my 5 yr. old Fuji Finepix 3800 digital camera was good, but this S2950 is so much better, and cost me about 50% less than the old one. Wide angle lens alone makes a huge difference when shooting cars. This camera also has both a thru the lens and 3 inch LCD view finder. Panorama feature is so easy to use and fun, too!

Reviews.Title: Excellent value and great photos!
Reviews.Author: Mark F. "netshark11"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my teenage daughter as a Christmas gift last year, as her first digital camera that wasn't a compact point-and-shoot.  She had experience with a 35mm student SLR and is interested in developing her skills and interest in photography as a hobby.  A full DSLR is still a little on the pricey side, but I wanted to get her something with a manual shooting mode and that was relatively easy to use and learn the basics of digital composition on.This camera fits the bill well.  It fits well in hand, and is relatively light, and compact enough to fit in a compact SLR camera bag, so she will actually take it with her places to shoot.  Battery life (as is true of many cameras in this class) was pretty average - meaning she was going through AA batteries quite often.  I'd highly recommend getting a set of Sanyo Eneloop rechargeable batteries or something similar for this camera for best performance and longevity.The user interface and controls on the camera are fairly intuitive, and easy to learn, even for a beginner.  She was shooting in several modes on the first day with great results.  The pictures are good quality, especially coming from the pre-programmed shooting modes.  As one advances, they can certainly customize settings to achieve more precise lighting, focus, and aperture control.All in all, I think this camera will set her up well to progress to a DSLR and more advanced photography if she so chooses.  And if not, the price was at the right price point that she'll have a great camera to take casual photos with!  My dad liked this camera so much that he picked one up himself for the times when he didn't want to haul out his DSLR gear, and has likewise been very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: this camera Its okay
Reviews.Author: Leandro Pena
Reviews.Content: the camera looks very professional, quality materials, making it tough, has a good zoom and many modes and scenes to take photos, but ultimately the quality of the photos is not as good, the photos do not have bright colors, is seen as opaque even have photos of cameras compared to other brands that are less professional and these are more alive and better quality, for the price I think it's okay but not as good as it looks.  thats my oppinion

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: djason
Reviews.Content: I really loved this camera. The 18x zoom worked great, although at first I wasn't fond of the quality, but once I messed with it for a while, I figured out how to make it better quality even after I had zoomed in all the way. It's light, but not so light that it feels cheap. I am not at all regretting my decision in purchasing this item. It uses 4 AA+ batteries, which is good, because if rechargeable batteries die quickly, and you can't go to the store and buy new ones in case it gets lost or you can't charge it at the time. It's very easy to use, and not very expensive at all. I saw a slightly better camera (the only difference was that it had 20x zoom and 16 MP) by Nikon for twice the price. Over all, it was pretty stinkin' amazing.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera
Reviews.Author: Jose Riofrio
Reviews.Content: This camera is the perfect choice for starters who want to gradually increase their photograph skills.It is very easy to use and the basic functions are really intuitive, so you don't need to read the manual to start shooting.Yo have very high picture quality and a "point and shoot" mode that allows you to get great pictures every time.With low light conditions you can also get very good results, but you need to combine the flash and scene selection to achieve them.If you want to have more control (and know what you are doing) you could use the manual adjustments just like a professional camera.If this camera had interchangeable lenses, it would be a professional camera.

Reviews.Title: Fugi
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fugiflim S2950 And so far seems to be a great camera for the price,and takes great pictures ,fits nice to the hand. And a big thing for me is the electronic view finder.I have had cameras with out it and it is real hard to take pitchers on a black screen on a sunny day.I will not buy them again. Thank you.  R.M.

Reviews.Title: A very good camera, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Jas
Reviews.Content: In the few months that I have owned the Fuji Finepix, I have taken well over 1,000 shots. So far, it's done a decent job. In my personal experience, I have been impressed with its performance outdoors and indoors with flash or in well-lit areas. It has not performed particularly well indoors without a flash when the lighting is low.Pros:-Excellent 18x zoom with wide angle lens.-Stunning outdoor photography in daylight.-Solid indoor photography with flash, or in well-lit rooms.-A strong flash. Can light up a large, pitch black Cathedral-style church.-Very good picture quality in video mode; 720p.-Panorama mode.-Optional pop-up flash. Not having to go through the menu every time to turn off the flash like I'm forced to do with my Canon is a plus.-Good grip to the camera. It feels comfortable in your hands.-Uses 4 AA batteries (highly recommend rechargeable).-Nice battery discharge feature.-Viewfinder.-Large LCD screen.-Quick start up time. Fairly quick shot to shot time, save when using flash.-High ISO available.-Continuous shooting available.Cons:-Poor indoor low-light photographs.-Camera zooming and autofocusing are LOUD in video mode.-Panoramic shots often do not stitch well.-No manual focus.-The auto white balancing leaves a lot to be desired.It's certainly not a professional camera or a perfect one, but it's a very good camera that most would find appealing. Very easy to use, and takes solid pictures except in low light. Looks spiffy too!

Reviews.Title: A wonderful Camera!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth L
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera (Fujifilm Finepix S2950) because I had a daughter - and I have always loved photography but couldn't afford a $600-$1200 camera. I thought 14 megapixel and 18x wide angle lens, I should be pretty happy with it.I couldn't be happier - except now the camera is a little older - and the pictures are blurry/fuzzy more often then not. I bought the extended warranty - and I am going to send it back, to get a replacement. I Love this camera - it takes AMAZING outdoor shots. Better then anything a regular little handheld digital camera or cell phone could take! I would be cautious when using the flash. It worked GREAT when I first bought the camera - and then it kinda just started going downhill. As for the picture resolution and how the pictures turn out - I love it when its working correctly. Another downfall, is it takes 4 batteries (AA) instead of 2 - so, rechargeable batteries are a must. I have 8, I use 4 and I charge 4 at all times. If you use your camera more then casually, I would suggest maybe an extra (3rd) set (one for charge, one for use, and one for backup). Other then the batteries, and the downhill flash, I would still recommend this camera to family/friends, because it does take WONDERFUL outdoor shots!If buying this camera, which in my opinion would be good for starting out photographers, or people who want that professional looking shot without the professional price! I would suggest getting an extended warranty, maybe 3 or 5 years. It's a little pricey - but worth it!

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP
Reviews.Author: goodmill "Laura"
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic camera! It takes really great, sharp photos and has lot of features. The menu and options are easy to use, and so far, the battery life with regular AA batteries is outstanding. I have been using the camera for several weeks with the same set of batteries.I have been shopping for a new camera for over a year, but just couldn't stand the $500 or more price tag on other cameras with similar features. This is a great buy for under $200.

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm FinePix S2950 14 MP . Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: Brent
Reviews.Content: Decided to get this camera and experiment before i make the jump to an SLR andi'm glad i did. This camera has fantastic features for the price. Picture quality is on par with what i expected and this is just using th Automatic settings. Can't wait to drill down and use manual settings. Body may be a bit small for those with large hands, but i ain't complaining. This was/is a good buy.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: dpd
Reviews.Content: Just purchased this camera and so far I love it, it does everything I need and more, would recommend it to a friend!! Shipping was fantastic, 2 days by fed-ex!! Couldn't be happier!

Reviews.Title: Broken already
Reviews.Author: M
Reviews.Content: I bought a Fujifilm FinePix S2950 Digital Camera on March 9, 2012 in order to capture treasured and wonderful experiences, and I loved it for the length that it was working. However, unfortunately just recently I went to use it and is not working (no physical damage whatsoever, I cherish this camera more than I cherish my phone or any other electronic device I carry). As I attempted to turn on my camera to capture the first few moments of my newborn niece this prior weekend, the screen advised that I "turned off and on" my camera. After about 50 attempts and just leaving it alone again for the day, it still is not working. I have contacted Fujifilm, but unfortunately my manufacturer warranty was up by just a few months. I called Fujifilm, and they will provide a "free evaluation" but I will have to pay for the shipping cost to send to NJ, and in the estimate they provide to me for the cost of repair, it will include the shipping to return my camera back to me. Well, regardless if I want my camera back, i'm still stuck paying shipping and handling. I am highly disappointed that only just shy of after a year I am having to go through this. At time of purchase, if I had known I would have a working camera for only a year, I would have gone with someone else.

Reviews.Title: Decent outdoor photos
Reviews.Author: Spork Dude "Spork Dude"
Reviews.Content: Camera only takes good photos outside in good ambient lighting. Inside photos, no matter what setting or configuration, are horrible. My old Sony 5MP take WAY better photos indoors than this one. This camera is obviously meant strictly for outdoor usage and even then, it's not fantastic, just decent. But what more can you ask, you really get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: all ok,
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: all ok, the only thing this camera is that the display has a minimal, almost invisible dead pixels, that is their only detail, takes great pictures, great quality camera, very nice has nothing to envy any other, the pictures you take are top quality and amazing videos .. a wonderful hd quality

Reviews.Title: what I expected and a little more
Reviews.Author: 3girls1guy
Reviews.Content: first off I would have given this a 5 star except the lens cap is not secure.  When out traveling or with the kids I toss the camera in the bag and off we go. I have not hunted down a possible solution for this annoying happening. I know some of the other reviews complained about this too. they were correct.  Otherwise as a family camera, it is great.  videos and picture quality are great for everyday use.  the camera is slight bulkier then the other slim point and shoots but the quality is worth it.  I cannot afford an SLR and wanted something better then a pocket size camera.  This is wonderful middle ground for a novice photographer.  the manual options are more then I will ever use and the auto setting are right on.

Reviews.Title: Nothing Impressive
Reviews.Author: Scott P.
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera from Fuji and was initially excited about it, but that excitement turned to disappoint after about 15 days when I sent it back to Fuji for a refund.While they market as a DSLR to be truthful my Canon power-shot point and shoot can walk circles around this camera.My biggest problems with this camera are:Picture Quality:While it shoots at 14MP the quality of the picture even on its highest settings is poor at best. The continuous shot mode on 20 shots shoots at only 3MP (My cell phone would shoot better pictures). The pictures are often grainy and the cameras proformance is slow with lag in storing pictures (even with a fast SD card) and there is a lot of delay on the settings buttons. I would push the preview button and it could take several seconds for the menu to come up.Lack of custom settings:The shutter speed only goes as slow as 8", the apature only has 2 adjustment settings, there is no adjustment for ISO, and while it does have a lot of nice features they are often hard to access through various poorly designed menus or complicated button sequences.Battery LifeThe camera used 4 AA batteries and if you are considering purchasing this camera you should definitely buy rechargeable batteries at the same time. This camera will burn through batteries faster than a can of mace at an Occupy Wall Street protest.Cheap feelThe camera has a cheap feel to it, especially so with the battery compartment located on the bottom of the camera that has a tendency to suddenly open or not close all the way.This camera is a good value for someone wanting to take good family pictures but if you know anything about photography this camera will only irritate you beyond belief.

Reviews.Title: If you do not disponde lot of money, this is a good camera. The lens is not interchangeable as SLR camera
Reviews.Author: juanesdi
Reviews.Content: Pros:-Long-running with Sanyo Eneloop AA rechargeable or alkaline batteries.-Good photo-memory speed class 10, 20 mbps.-Not as big or as heavy as an SLR.-Optical and digital zoom, up to 120.6 X.-Good quality video recording.-I find it best to work with rechargeable AA batteries are cheaper than the batteries from the manufacturer and may take longer for the amperage of the 4 batteries.-It takes very good pictures.-Good price and quality.-The EVF works for this purpose.  Cons:-The manual mode lets not adjust all parameters.-The lens cap is not completely fixed, sometimes no more is uncovered.-Requires more information for easy adjustment of parameters.-I think no battery life meter.-Has no internal memory, SD card required.Still give it 5 stars.----------------------------En Castellano:Si usted no disponde de mucho dinero, esta es una buena cámara. La lente no es intercambiable como una SLR.Pros:-Largo funcionamiento con pilas AA recargables Sanyo Eneloop, o alcalinas.-Buena velocidad de fotos con memoria clase 10, 20 mbps.-Nos es tan grande ni tan pesada como una Slr.-Buen zoom óptico, hasta 120,6X con zoom digital-Buena calidad de grabación de video.-Me parece mejor que funcione a pilas AA recargables, son mas baratas que las baterias del fabricante y pueden durar más por el amperaje de las 4 pilas.-Toma muy buenas fotos.-Buen precio y calidad.-El visor EVF funciona bien para el efecto. Cons:-El modo manual no deja ajustar todos los parámetros.-La tapa de la lente no queda totalmente fija, a veces se destapa sin más.-Precisa de más información para el fácil ajuste de parámetros.-Creo que no tiene medidor de duración de bateria.-No tiene memoria interna, requiere una tarjeta SD.A pesar de todo le doy 5 estrellas.Salu2 desde Paraguay

Reviews.Title: Solid Performance
Reviews.Author: P. B. Terry
Reviews.Content: Tough to write technical reviews for a tech-based product that will be out-moded in a year or so. Suffice to say, the FujiFIlm FinePix2950 is a solid performer. Quality images, decent features, good battery life. It's not a pocket point-and-shoot and it's not a DSLR, but something in-between that shoots finepix!

Reviews.Title: Great pictures
Reviews.Author: Robert Lee
Reviews.Content: I need a camera with wide angle shots and would recover faster than the one I had. works great automatically or manually. Nice camera for the money

Reviews.Title: Good enough camera for a fair price
Reviews.Author: Lucy Ramos
Reviews.Content: It was a good buy. The flash is poor. All else is good so far. I would recommend for a beginner.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Marietta Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Really like it.  Uses AA batteries.  Takes good photos.  Small and easy to carry.  Does not pull on my neck as my previous, heavier cameras did.  I have taken many photos indoors w/o flash.

Reviews.Title: Perfect pictures
Reviews.Author: Lucky1
Reviews.Content: Great pictures great movies. simple to use, My wife and I both find it easy to use indoors and out in all lighting.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Allen S.
Reviews.Content: I found this camera to be a good value for the price. I have not figured out all the settings that this camera has but am happy with most of the results I have got with this camera. It would be easier to have a manual that explains the various settings and how to use them instead of having to go online to look it up. This practice of manufactures just adding a manual for basic operation is a BIG NEGATIVE ON RATINGS. I want to know how to use all the products functions without having to go online. I want to have a manual in my hands for looking up the different functions and how and when to use them out in the field when I don't have online access. This is something that all manufactures should do for the consumers satifaction,they have the full manual online so to save costs they give you manuals that are very basic and really of no use to the consumer. So to all manufactures don't be so cheap start giving the consumer a full manual with your products. I don't believe That I am the only one who feels this way on this subject.

Reviews.Title: fuzzy focusing
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We've had this camera for 3 months now and it's not as good at really impressive pictures as my old Olympus 10x optical.  I tried to take a pic of a brown recluse spider, just to compare, and could not get the macro to work.  A few days back, i tried to zoom in on some boats in the distance.  Beyond recognizing them as houseboats, not much good. I took some better shots with my droid phone and could blow them up, then crop the excess, including the close up of the spider.I've had a fair number of cameras that exceeded my abilities.  This one is not as smart as it should have been to make up for my skills.  My Canon slr and the Olympus i think were better at taking good pics without having to manually adjust.The panorama feature is nice, and it does take good, long movies (for a camera).  And it takes good pics if you have a no brainer shot at up to 30 ft and good light, or within flash distance.My recommendation is to go somewhere you can test the features better than i did.I would send this back if i could and look for another.  Does not work as well as i expected for the money.

Reviews.Title: learning takes a while
Reviews.Author: mac
Reviews.Content: i like the fuifilm fine pix camera so far.  the pictures are clear and the color good.  i found that sometimes when i am at 16x the camera just doesn't work or is very fuzzy..  i wish i had known that there wasn't a booklet with the camera.  the disc is fine but i have no reference when i am not near the computer.

Reviews.Title: Nice pic
Reviews.Author: Juaco
Reviews.Content: it's almost a profesional camera for anyone who wants to take realy good pictures. Easy to operate and with the perfect size and weigth to be you trip partner

Reviews.Title: Faulty cheaply made camera
Reviews.Author: B. Bowersox "glaurung26"
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a replacement for my old fujifilm s3200 which has lasted me 7 years.  It had been dropped down stair and scratched up and works great to this day.  I wanted a better camera with good video features.  This one seemed good on paper.  It worked okay for about a month but I noticed purple lines in almost all of my videos.  Then the on/off switch started giving me problems.  Sometimes it works sometimes it doesn't.  Sometimes it slides, sometimes it clicks.  It is constantly faulty now and I can turn my camera on and it will turn off immediately because the switch isn't working.  I contacted Fujifilm about it and they told me to ship the camera at my expense to them and they would determine if it is under warranty!  I just bought it a month ago!  I'm seriously disappointed in Fujifilm.  I wish I could return it to amazon but it's just past my 1 month return date.  I really want a different camera and this will be the last fujifilm I buy.

Reviews.Title: good but not great!
Reviews.Author: K. alford
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews so much.. i figured i wanted a really good camera to start taking photo's of my family. however this does a good job, BUT its not any better than my other point and shoot!  i have yet to learn everything. i have only had this camera for 24 hrs now. It does the job.. i do not like the fact the flash is not right there when i need it..i have to push a button and pop it out! the battery directions are honestly complicated.. who new putting batteries in your camera was complicated!hmmm anyways, i guess over all this will be ok, just not what i expected for getting such a high star rateing! THE CAMERA IS LIGHT, you need just the right light settings for your picture to turn out correct. most of the pictures i have taken are a little fuzzy as well.  good luck

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAM!!!
Reviews.Author: CAM LOVE
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. It does exactly what I need it to do. Theres not too many dslr cam's that does what this does at this price. Before wasting time and money, I did my research on youtube and on other sites. THANKS AMAZON

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: Was debating between this one, a kodak and a Sanyo of similar type.  Finally decided on the Fuji.  My wife loves it, easy to use, lots of functions, and takes great pictures.

Reviews.Title: I love love love this camera
Reviews.Author: SeriouslyImKidding
Reviews.Content: Excellent step from point and click to DSLR.  I've been having fun with it on vacations and at family functions over the last few months.For those who say the camera doesn't take good pictures inside, they're probably using the incorrect settings.  I've had no problems thus far.  Just play with it until you've got a good feel for what works.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camerai
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter for Christmas. We were both very very satisfied with the look of the product and the performance.  It takes wonderful pictures, I was quite surprised for such a cheap camera to do such a great job.  Very very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Good Product at Good Price
Reviews.Author: David Trumbull
Reviews.Content: Got it for my wife who knows nothing about digital cameras. In no time at all she was taking beautiful pictures. Good combination of auto point-and-click features and manual over-rides for artistic work. Old-fashioned view-finder as well as screen is a really aid when shooting outdoors in bright light that can may screen viewing difficult. Nice that it runs on common AA batteries available everywhere.As some other reviewers have noted, the lens cap pops off too easily and the door for the batteries is flimsy, so I recommend that anyone who buys this camera buy a cheap case for it so you don't risk losing those important covers.Also, note, this camera does not come with a memory card. So if you plan to surprise someone with a gift, as I did, you better take the camera out of the box, go spend a few bucks on a memory card, and put it in. Fortunately, I had done exactly that, so my wife was able to open it on Christmas Day and start using it immediately.It's not professional quality DSLR, but it is also no where near the cost of a DSLR. For "bridge camera" between the point-and-click and the DSLR it is very good and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: FujiFilm camera
Reviews.Author: Mavesons
Reviews.Content: Product meets and exceeds expectations. Takes Great pictures, easy to use and offers so many options for taking pictures and videos.Delivered right on time...

Reviews.Title: Pleased
Reviews.Author: HelloCasey
Reviews.Content: After my digital camera broke I wanted something that I knew would last, but Im not into photography, I just like taking nice pictures, I didn't want to break the bank. So I went to target and saw this, they wanted $250 for it. I come on here and see it and with the price I had to get it. I played with it and got familiar with the settings, and for me I think it takes good pictures indoors and out. I wasn't expecting a top notch camera with a bunch of different settings. But for this price, and its quality, I think its a great buy. I take good care of it, I really don't see me buying a new camera anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Juan Jose Oviedo
Reviews.Content: It's a nice camera, only two things I wish were different, 1 changeable lens to achive longer distance and 2 Automatic Flash, you have to pull it up every time in order to take a picture with it, but besides that is a nice camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful camera
Reviews.Author: Oxford_girl
Reviews.Content: This camera was more than I expected, I am truly happy with my purchase! The quality is best outside but when you use it inside it isn't bad either. The price is such a steal, I LOVE IT!!! I recommend this camera!

Reviews.Title: Great camera for any photographer
Reviews.Author: Jonathan
Reviews.Content: This is a truly great camera. The battery compartment is extremely easy to operate, unlike the previous canon I owned. The pictures that you can take with this camera are of insanely good quality - the video is also pretty good. The macro mode is a feature I use a lot for close-ups of plants. The panorama capability is a nice little gadget, but i don't think i'll ever really use it. Also, the menus are very easy to navigate. There are a ton of features I didn't mention, as i'm still trying to master the manual mode. Overall, this is an amazing product that i would surely buy again. Just make sure to bet a warranty, just in case.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Eka Aditya
Reviews.Content: This camera is really good, a lot of features, easy to use, luxurious and nice looking, and good price also.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: BonWalters
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera a few days ago and just love how easy it is to use. If you are familiar with digital cameras most things are similar enough to figure it out. Some things I did have to look up but overall it was easy to just open and use.

Reviews.Title: Mr. McGoo of Digital Cameras
Reviews.Author: danapelletier
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera for still photography with superior performance to my obsolete 3.5Mp x10 Olympus C-470.  It had to run on AAs for use in the field, have a x10 to x20 zoom, higher res, better dynamic range.  You'd think ANYTHING on the market could beat a seven-year-old midrange unit.  Not true.I hoped the Fujifilm Finepix S2950 would fit the bill.  It came highly rated.  It looked like the perfect fit.  I quickly found out it isn't. At least I know what the "S" stands for in the model line- as in piece of...In its defense it has a superb CCD- low noise and high resolution.  It's software is quite sophisticated, yet easy to use.  But its optics are HORRIBLE.  Its images are cloudy- even in the 3" LCD, which shows how bad the images look on a big screen or printed out.  It isn't the fault of the autofocus.  There are serious abberations in the lens components that no setting or common tricks could get around.  The images couldn't be rescued in post processing.My ancient Olympus runs rings around the Fuji S2950.  Luckily the store was good about taking it back.

Reviews.Title: Fuji Film Finepix s2950
Reviews.Author: Jerrica Goodwin
Reviews.Content: My husband bought this camera for me as an early birthday present. I was using just a standard Nikon digital camera but using this one is like a whole new realm of amazing. I enjoy everything about this camera. I read the manual that came with it and it's fairly simple to use. We live in the desert and you won't find this camera far from me, ever.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: I am the man
Reviews.Content: I was gonna give 1 star, but maybe my unit was defective.  The lcd is super grainy.  The audio recording and playback is terribly noisy.  I found a review after I had purchased it that summed it up  as a cheapy point and shoot with a huge lens slapped on it.  I wouldn't recommend this camera to anyone. I am typically skeptical of reviews that mention other products but the Lumix f40 is the bomb. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera / Loaded w / Features!
Reviews.Author: capeannman
Reviews.Content: This camera does everything I need to take great pictures near and far. the 18x zoom and super macro are great features. Easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Just what I was looking for.
Reviews.Author: CRG in Redding
Reviews.Content: This camera is a bargain for the price. It takes great pictures with ease. The number of useful features is way beyond what I expected to get. The controls are logically located and very reachable. One particularly practical feature is that it automatically pushes off the lens cap when you turn it on so no more completely black shots. Do yourself a favor and get one if you're looking for an easy to use high quality camera. I'm very satisfied with my choice.Clifford Graham

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Alberto Mattar "BERTIMUS MAXIMUS"
Reviews.Content: About two years ago I purchased the fujifilm finepix s1500 with 10 mega pixel and 12x zoom. The camera was great and never had any issues , this year me and my wife took a cruise to Cozumel and Belize. We purchased the fuji s2950 as an upgrade. Most of all the features were the same the difference was the color, everything looked great. I cant really see the difference in the megapixel but the zoom was also a good upgrade. Overall the camera is good, takes good pictures has all the great features needed when taking pictures in nature and out at sea. I gave the rating a 4 because although it takes better pictures not much changed from the models.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: Rseneff
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my daughter, who is taking photography in high school.  As soon as she opened it, she creamed, Camera 4!  This is one of the cameras they use in class, and apparently this is the class favorite.  They rush to class to get this one.  So enough said, I am her hero for getting this camera.  She has been using it constantly every since.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Rocky V
Reviews.Content: Camera came on time in perfect condition. It was a Christmas gift for my wife but I gave it to her early so she could use it during the holidays. She went crazy with it! We live on a tropical island so she was always going to the beach and the rain forest to take photos. The quality of the photos and the zoom were amazing. Great features especially for the price. Would think cause it uses 4 batteries it would wste alot of power but it doesn't! I bought some Walgreens Alkaline Batteries that were on sale and I used those babies for almost a week of non-stop photo sessions. No cons yet. It's a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: Donna McKinley
Reviews.Content: this was a gift for my daughter to take pictures of her trip to India she isn't back yet so I hope her camera is still good and lasts a long time I don't know wht she thinks of i

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: Dorothy A. Brock
Reviews.Content: This camera has so many capabilities and is easy to use.  It is comfortable to hold so remains steady.  It takes 4 AA lithium batteries which are easy to obtain and comes with a plug in charger.  I did download an online bound manual as there are so many choices you can make.  It's fun to use and experiment with and has an excellent rating.I would highly recommend this camera for someone who has some photography experience.

Reviews.Title: Its OK
Reviews.Author: kemalk67
Reviews.Content: I used other leading brands as well as fuji before but this camera as much as very easy to use it is not what I want high mega pixel but quality is low

Reviews.Title: Good for the price (that I paid two years ago...)
Reviews.Author: jdbjr "JDB"
Reviews.Content: I have been using this camera for a little over two years now. (It was nearly half the price back then that they are asking for it today.) I am not a professional photographer and only take pictures when the mood strikes, so I didn't want to invest in a really nice/expensive camera. For my purposes, this camera works well. Mainly, I photograph and record holiday gatherings, pets, and wildlife. The pictures and videos I have made with this camera are decent. They are mostly clear, except for when I move during photographing. I like this camera, but as there are more advanced versions in the Fujifilm Finepix family (for nearly the same price), I would recommend investigating them before committing to this one. I am currently looking to purchase a Fujifilm that has a longer zoom on it. They cost only a little more than what I paid for this version, and, depending on how much zoom you want, cost very close to what they are currently asking for this one. Overall, a good camera for the amateur or incidental photographer.

Reviews.Title: Good easy to use and does the job of a movie camera also. this is my second one as the first one was destroid when our house bur
Reviews.Author: Gene Lynch
Reviews.Content: These cameras are unlike many other cameras as they will take Approx. 300 pictures on one set of batteries. I use rechargeable batteries

Reviews.Title: Don't bother
Reviews.Author: VeronicaMD
Reviews.Content: This is the crappiest camera in the history of cameras. Don't waste your money. I have a bunch of blurry memories.

Reviews.Title: Thank you
Reviews.Author: Arthur
Reviews.Content: It's nice camera for a good price.The item is exactly as described and have excellent zoom and image quality

Reviews.Title: Love...
Reviews.Author: William David Woods
Reviews.Content: Love this camera. Only use on special occasions. Very good pictures, sturdy & light for it's size. Would get another.

Reviews.Title: Never again
Reviews.Author: keith wittman
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera 2 years ago. figured it was a good camera with the name alone. Does not take good pictures,. The picture are ok but for the money I would expect a lot clearer. Also the time between each photo is so long. I would NOT recommend this camera at all.

Reviews.Title: Not a bad
Reviews.Author: Ilia
Reviews.Content: Not a very good quality build, pictures are good, but got broken after an year anyway for the price not a bad camera!

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Sunshine State
Reviews.Content: Picture, video quality is POOR.  requires 4 AA batteries that will last for very short time, (about 2 games of our son's flag football) by the time you spend 6 month of use you could bought a better camera with the added cost of AA batteries.  (so far I do not have luck with rechargeable batteries).  I guess this is between a compact point then shoot and a SLR, yet my Panasonic Lumix SZ1 16.1 MP Digital Camera with 10x Optical Zoom (Black) takes much better picture and HD video, user FRIENDLY, HIGHER pix, SMALLER and cost LESS.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Samantha ODonnell
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for my husband for Christmas a few years ago. He is a realtor and needs to take pictures of the houses he is selling but also likes to dabble in photography. We weren't willing to shell out all the money for a real DSLR for him to just play with but this one works well. Its significantly better than his cell phone camera and he enjoys using it. Takes good pictures and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Marge90601 "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: My favorite mid size camera. Intuitive knobs. Great close ups. It even came with rechargeable batteries. There was only one, so you probably can't get it again at this price from this seller. I was lucky. Damage proof packing.

Reviews.Title: Dissapointed
Reviews.Author: MMSahler
Reviews.Content: Overall pretty good pictures. ...That is unless you have anything other than copious light available.The firmware has some glitches like it randomly turns on the speaker while in picture taking modes and makes white noise.The lens cap falls off for like no reason.The flash goes off a half dozen times before it actually takes the picture (so everyone is blinded and has their eyes closed in pictures).Very poor stabilization.
